output:
```json
{
  "new_problem": "no",
  "proof_sketch": "Step 1) Define characteristic polynomial p(t) = det(A - tI) for n×n matrix A over algebraically closed field F.

Step 2) Since F is algebraically closed, p(t) factors completely: p(t) = (-1)^n(t - λ₁)(t - λ₂)...(t - λₙ) where λ_i are eigenvalues with algebraic multiplicity.

Step 3) Expand the product: (t - λ₁)(t - λ₂)...(t - λₙ) = t^n - (∑λ_i)t^{n-1} + ... + (-1)^n(∏λ_i).

Step 4) Compute coefficient of t^{n-1} in det(A - tI) expansion using determinant formula: det(A - tI) = Σ_{σ∈S_n} sgn(σ) Π_{i=1}^n (a_{iσ(i)} - tδ_{iσ(i)}).

Step 5) Identify terms contributing to t^{n-1}: Choose '-t' from exactly one diagonal position (i,i) and a_{jj} from all other diagonal positions.

Step 6) Sum contributions: For each i, term is -t × a_{11} × ... × a_{i-1,i-1} × a_{i+1,i+1} × ... × a_{nn}. Summing gives coefficient -∑a_{ii} = -tr(A).

Step 7) Write p(t) = t^n - (tr A)t^{n-1} + ... + (-1)^n det A.

Step 8) Compare coefficients from steps 3 and 7: -tr A = -(∑λ_i).

Step 9) Conclude tr A = λ₁ + λ₂ + ... + λₙ, proving trace equals sum of eigenvalues."
}
```
